alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northern Cayuga; Ontario; Wayne (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:26PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Showers and Thunderstorms with Heavy Rain Through Mid Afternoon... At 123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking an area of heavy showers and embedded thunderstorms over the region, including a relatively strong thunderstorm near East Rochester, moving east at 50 mph. This activity is producing one hour rainfall of an inch to an inch and a half in some areas. This will certainly lead to significant ponding on area roadways and could lead to some poor drainage and urban flooding. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rochester, Irondequoit, East Rochester, Webster, Fairport, Brighton, Fair Haven Beach State Park, Ontario, Penfield, Newark, Williamson, Marion, Lyons, Palmyra, Victor, Honeoye Falls, Clifton Springs, Clyde, Phelps and Sodus. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 45 and 42. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
